newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: DMCI Holdings Q1 net at about 250 mln pesos.
newsitem.headline: DMCI Holdings Q1 net at about 250 mln pesos.

text.p: Construction concern DMCI Holdings Inc posted a net income of about 250 million pesos in the first quarter from revenues of 1.8 billion pesos, company president Isidro Consunji told stockholders on Wednesday.
He did not give comparative figures for last year.
As of the end of the first quarter, the firm's backlog of orders reached 9.5 billion pesos, Consunji said.

This figure does not yet include the upcoming projects from the Rockwell commercial development project worth six billion pesos and and from gaming firm Belle Corp worth 1.1 billion pesos, the official said.
In the same meeting, DMCI officials said unit Semirara Coal Corp made a net income of 55 million pesos in the first quarter after posting losses in recent years.
DMCI Holdings had just acquired 66 percent of Semirara early this year.
Officials said DMCI is now in the process of reducing Semirara's 1.24 billion-peso long-term debt to 250 million pesos.
DMCI had earlier said it plans to build a $250 million cement plant with the purchase of Semirara, which mines coal in Semirara island in central Philippines.
